intro: Sanguisorba stipulata, commonly known as the slender dock, is a perennial herb native to Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are small, clustered in spikes, and typically appear in shades of pink or red. Sanguisorba stipulata is often found in moist meadows and woodland edges, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
